a.title: Go to Frederick Area School District

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

a.title: JH & HS activities for social distancing
a.span: JH & HS activities for social distancing

li.a: JH & HS activities for social distancing

p.span: Parents I am sharing with you some resources that hopefully can aid you during the coming weeks that your children will be learning from home. I know your amazing teacher have been sending home work to be done, but there is still a lot of strain on your family. Many of these are articles. I feel everyone will get something different from them, but know you are not alone in trying to juggle home-schooling as well as working during this difficult time. Remember even on the most difficult of days you are doing AMAZING!
Always remember that I am available by e-mail if anything arises and I will do my absolute best to assist, e-mail me at ashley.schmidt@k12.sd.us

li.span: The Yucky Bug by Julia Cook explains how a virus works and talks about how they can help the spread of illness.
Resource for talking to your children about the COVID virus.
This article addresses ways to cope with the stress and anxiety that has been caused by the COVID-19 outbreak both for yourself and your children.
This site also has a lot of linked resources from protecting your home and family from illness.
For some fun activities for your own stay at home field trip please visit this website you can visit Zoos, historical museums and more!

Creating a schedule to follow will also aid in the chaos of home learning, do whatever works best for your family, this means still sticking to a sleep schedule, meal time, school/academic time, recess/activity time, creative time, as well as free time. There are dozens of examples of this out there if you just search Google. This is one that I found:
